snippet: Mitt Romney criticized the weaker-than-expected employment numbers, while President Obama focused on taking action against raising the borrowing rates for student loans.
abstract: Mitt Romney seizes on weaker-than-expected employment report, citing it as evidence that the economy continues to slow under Pres Obama's stewardship; Obama responds by emphasizing several proposals he has put forward to revive the job market in the face of a hostile Congress.

byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington. Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Pittsburgh.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney criticized the weaker-than-expected employment numbers, while President Obama focused on taking action against raising the borrowing rates for student loans.

headline.seo: Job Numbers Become Instant Campaign Fodder
headline.main: Job Numbers Become Instant Campaign Fodder
headline.print_headline: Job Numbers Become Instant Campaign Fodder
